message: Fix NullPointerExceptions in location config

message: BROOKLYN-568: fix NPE on SshFeed rebind
fix npe that can occur with WinRM when no subnet IP, do a better job of returning public IP but above all don't NPE
guard against possible NPE when rebinding legacy catalog items
BROOKLYN-537: fix NPE listing catalog items
identify NPE earlier
BROOKLYN-120: fix NPE in /v1/server/up/extended
Sanitizer: avoid NPE on `sanitize(null)`

Rest API location transformers use mutable map

LocationConfig contains null values which Guava's ImmutableMap rejects
with a NullPointerException

Closes #391

Enable BasicExecutionManager logging for specific exceptions

A NullPointerException in ServiceReplacer was being swallowed in BasicExecutionManager, this makes exemptions for logging specific types of Exceptions.

Closes #618

Sanitizer: avoid NPE on `sanitize(null)`
BROOKLYN-386: Avoid NPE in JcloudsSshMachineLocation.getOptionalNode
Fixes potential NPE
Time.makeTimeString: avoid NPE if arg is null
Fix NPE in forcePersistNow

Try to fix NPE in TomcatAutoScalerPolicyTest

- JavaSoftwareProcessSshDriver.getJmxPort throwing NPE

Avoid NPE in REST api deserialisation

- motivated by NPE in TaskSummary<init> for tags
getEffectorByName returns absent rather than throwing NPE when arg null.

JmxSupport: improve NPE message when jmxPort null

Was previously throwing NPE converting the null attribute value to
an `int`.
JcloudsSshMachineLocation: avoid NPE on rebind
Sanitizer: avoid NPE if sanitize null key
Check for NPE in tests and use isPositive check for Duration
Rebind NPE fixes
BROOKLYN-225: avoid NPE in SshMachineLocation cleanup

BROOKLYN-303: Fix EmptyWindowsProcess

Previously gave NPE in driver
MachineEntity.exec: better NPE if no driver

Closes #719

Check versionedName to avoid NPE.

Fixes break from https://github.com/apache/brooklyn-server/pull/672,
I merged without re-running unit tests :-(

Check versionedName to avoid NPE.

Fixes break from https://github.com/apache/brooklyn-server/pull/672,
I merged without re-running unit tests :-(
Fix NPE in removeMember

Merge pull request #930 from aledsage/fix/NPE-from-ConfigKeys-fields-strike2

Fix: NPE from ConfigKeys fields
Task serializer: avoid NPE if task result is null
fix NPE

JcloudsLocation: avoid NPE on user-creation

If jclouds node doesn’t know its operatingSystem, then was
getting NPE. Guard against that, and default to unix.
fix NPE in SensorResource

Fix Entities.waitForServiceUp to avoid NPE

- Never return null for repeater’s `until`; always return TRUE or FALSE.
  Otherwise it will NPE.
BROOKLYN-215: fix NPE when SshMachineLocation.port==null
Avoid NPE in BrooklynWebServer.stop
Dumpers.logUnserializableChains: handle NPEs
fix NPE in locaton rebinding
Prevent DynamicCluster NPE when subclasses have not called super.init()

Closes #205

BROOKLYN-303: Fix EmptyWindowsProcess

Previously gave NPE in driver

Closes #197

Fix JcloudsSshMachineLocation.getSubnetIp

Previously would throw NPE if privateAddresses was empty.
Jclouds openIptables: avoid NPE if no inboundPorts

Fix JcloudsSshMachineLocation.getSubnetIp

Previously would throw NPE if privateAddresses was empty.
winrm: avoid NPE if command==null && psCommand==null
avoid NPE resolving camp yaml
JcloudsLocation: avoid NPE on rebindMachine

Merge pull request #951 from aledsage/fix/NPE-EntityDynamicType-constructor-calling-entity.toString

Fix NPE when EntityDynamicType constructor calling entity.toString
JcloudsLocation: avoid NPE if node.getImageId null

Closes #113

Fix NPE in forcePersistNow

Fixes issue where `forcePeristNow()` fails due to `persistenceRealChangeListener` being null
prevent NPE due to applicationName being null
Fix NPE on getJmxSensors
Fix NPE when jclouds image does not have OsFamily
fix NPE in BrooklynYamlTypeInstantiatorTest (supertype is null)
rebind's loadMemento: guard against NPE
Fix NPE when processOwner not set
Avoid NPE in toMetadataRecord for jclouds machine
Fix NPE on creating entities with no explicit location
Avoid NPE on SoftwareProcessEntity.start(null)
Geo info: log and fix NPE
don't cause NPE inside location list coercions (alt fix for recent fix for NPE from where this is invoked in MachineLifecycleTasks), and some notes on jclouds location for softlayer
fix for NPE when passphrase not set
Fixed the NPE problems with the pools
BalanceablePoolModel: avoid NPE if duplicate onContainerRemoved received
avoid NPE on rebind when locations have been unmanaged
Fix NPE if loginUser is not present and useJcloudsSshInit is false
HA master promotion: avoid NPE if no valid masters
jsonya now no-op if put(null), previously threw NPE

avoid NPE in AbstractLocation if creationTimeUtc null

- happens if you unmanaged and then remanage an entity.
- the old creationTimeUtc will have been deleted from storage so will
  be null, so doing `long l = createTimeUtc.get()` NPEs
fix NPE resolving name/id from web api
networkutils fix; npe on when a port is null
Whirr integration: avoid NPE in stop, when start was unsuccessful
Avoid NPE when item has no workrate in map
HttpSensorAdapter: avoid NPE if URL returns empty string
summing/averaging aggregator: avoid NPE if sensor value is null

could get NPE if application was GC'd at same time as location, do not fail in that case

we want to make sure a record is generated, even if it is incomplete

Fix JMX adapter for when ActiveMQ throwns NPE

ActiveMQ sometimes throws NPE in MBeanServer during startup,
but when retrying then the problem goes away it seems.

These changes make the JmxSensorAdapter code more robust to this
kind of error.

Avoid NPE in JcloudsUtil.dockerPortMappingsFor

- happened if container.getNetworkSettings().getPorts() returned null

HA manager: loadManagementPlaneSyncRecord avoid NPE if persister null

- return an empty ManagementPlaneSyncRecordImpl

Disable HA when running from BrooklynRestApiLauncher

Otherwise HighAvailabilityManagerImpl throws NPE when creating
management record
JcloudsLocation: No NPE if setup.script is given but not setup.script.vars

strings.join does not throw NPE

useful when using the joiner enricher if the inputted list is null

Merge pull request #920 from aledsage/fix/BrooklynLauncher-supplying-ManagementContext

Fix NPE when BrooklynLauncher given ManagementContext

Fix NPE when BrooklynLauncher given ManagementContext

- caused by brooklynProperties being null

Sensor feed JsonFunctions: avoid NPE

- In cast(Class), return null if input is null

Merge pull request #395 from aledsage/fix/npe-EntityManagementSupport

EntityManagementSupport: defensive programming

file.patch: @@ -32,8 +32,8 @@ * * * @param flags optional parameters to be associated with the subscription - * @param producer entity to listen to - * @param sensor sensor channel of events to listen to + * @param producer entity to listen to, or null to listen to all entities + * @param sensor sensor channel of events to listen to, or null for all sensors from the given producer(s) * @param listener callback to invoke when an event occurs * @return an id for this subscription *

message:
Avoids npe in SshMachineLocation.toString

(e.g. if exception during configure(), before address has been set).
workaround for WSO2-specific JMX error condition (throws NPE when contract expects an IOE) (via pveentjer)
correct description and tidied code for determining backup location spec v non-backup location spec, fixing NPE's
create specs from catalog items, and use these in many places.  also fix some NPE and serialization issues.

Disable `-use` in javadoc generation

- fix for NPE when trying to deploy 0.6.0-M1 to sonatype

file.patch:
@@ -305,6 +305,11 @@
                     <version>2.8</version>
                     <inherited>true</inherited>
                     <configuration>
+                        <!-- disabling use because of NPE deploying to sonatype:
+                             http://stackoverflow.com/questions/888199/why-does-maven-install-fail-during-javadoc-generation
+                             http://bugs.sun.com/bugdatabase/view_bug.do;jsessionid=ac084ab7f47c4e7f1df2117cecd?bug_id=5101868
+                        -->
+                        <use>false</use>
                         <links>
                             <link>http://download.oracle.com/javaee/6/api</link>
                         </links>

message:
Avoid NPE in BasicEntityMemento creation

- Either an attribute sensor key passed in was null,
  or (less likely) getStaticSensorKeys() return null.

Deletes keys defined in ConfigKeys

- Update all uses to the new BrooklynConfigKeys
- Was previously deprecated, with fields in ConfigKeys referencing
  those in BrooklynConfigKeys. But this led to strange NPEs where
  ConfigKeys fields were null (presumably due to ordering of
  initialising the two classes' fields)!
- Breaks backwards compatibility, but better to have a compilation error
  than a weird NPE.

Merge pull request #120 from pveentjer/fix-networkutils

networkutils fix; npe on when a port is null

minor geo-lookup fixes

occasional NPE in utrace lookup, deprecate geobytes lookup whose api has changed, better messages in integration test

Rebind: avoid NPEs and FileNotFound

- Was getting NPE in RebindManagerImpl.waitForPendingComplete 
  if was not running (so changeListener had not been set)
- Was not waiting for Persister's executor to shutdown, so 
  test tearDown deleting directory while thread trying to write
  file.

Merge pull request #1474 from ahgittin/couchbase

Couchbase code tidy, nicer way to define sensors, and prevent NPE's, using new `Functionals`

Fix SshMachineLocation NPE

- sshPoolCache initialisation was moved to init() previously
  But for things that instantiate SshMachineLocation directly then
  the framework won't have called init.

JcloudsLocation: support unsetting config

- if set null loginUser, loginUserPassword, etc then don't pass it
  through to jclouds (i.e. don't NPE)
don't throw NPE when named location refers to another (causing locations in catalog to fail), and extend unit test to trap this error

Fixes BrooklynMetricsTest non-deterministic failures

Failed once with NPE because NUM_SUBSCRIPTIONS sensor hadn't
been set yet, so couldn't cast value to long.

Sshj: gracefully handle null env variables

log.warn and ignore environment variable that has null key or value.
Previously, it NPE'ed so command wasn't executed.
fix misc errors during hot standby (access to unavailable methods, clearing more things on location unmanagement) and after rebind (NPE in SshMachineLocation), and fix sensor logic bug in tomcat

Fix integration tests

- NginxUrlMapping: test webapp changed, so writes out original url rather
  than url-mapping id
- Fix ElasticJavaWebAppServiceIntegrationTest
- Avoid NPE in ReflectionScanner if class can't be found
- fix RabbitSshDriver imports

Use FrameworkLookup class to get the bundle context.

Necessary to avoid NPE at line 135 and 160 if the class being looked up is in a bundle that hasn't started yet.
We don't really need to get the bundle context from that class, any suitable one will do, and we know that
the bundle we live in has started!

Closes #99

Rest API location transformers use mutable map

LocationConfig contains null values which Guava's ImmutableMap rejects with a NullPointerException.

This fixes an error observed when deploying the "Template 1: Server" sample to localhost then running `br application <id>` with the CLI. The output from the CLI was "500 Server Error". The server logs contained:

```
java.lang.NullPointerException: null value in entry: byon.machineSpecs=null
	at com.google.common.collect.CollectPreconditions.checkEntryNotNull(CollectPreconditions.java:33) ~[com.google.guava-guava-16.0.1.jar:na]
	at com.google.common.collect.ImmutableMap.entryOf(ImmutableMap.java:135) ~[com.google.guava-guava-16.0.1.jar:na]
	at com.google.common.collect.ImmutableMap$Builder.put(ImmutableMap.java:206) ~[com.google.guava-guava-16.0.1.jar:na]
	at org.apache.brooklyn.rest.transform.LocationTransformer.copyConfig(LocationTransformer.java:128) ~[org.apache.brooklyn-brooklyn-rest-resources-0.10.0-SNAPSHOT.jar:0.10.0-SNAPSHOT]
	at org.apache.brooklyn.rest.transform.LocationTransformer.newInstance(LocationTransformer.java:189) ~[org.apache.brooklyn-brooklyn-rest-resources-0.10.0-SNAPSHOT.jar:0.10.0-SNAPSHOT]
	at org.apache.brooklyn.rest.resources.LocationResource.get(LocationResource.java:139) ~[org.apache.brooklyn-brooklyn-rest-resources-0.10.0-SNAPSHOT.jar:0.10.0-SNAPSHOT]
	at org.apache.brooklyn.rest.resources.LocationResource.get(LocationResource.java:132) ~[org.apache.brooklyn-brooklyn-rest-resources-0.10.0-SNAPSHOT.jar:0.10.0-SNAPSHOT]
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) ~[na:1.8.0_05]

```

BrooklynYamlLocationResolver: don’t swallow exception

Previously inresolveLocation() we were just getting the “collapseText”
of the exception in the thrown toString, rather than having the
cause set. This meant that the underlying cause (e.g. of an NPE etc)
was never being logged.

Instead, set the cause when throwing the the IllegalStateException,
as well as having the nice toString.

Avoid NPE in PortForwardManager.rebindSupport

- caused by publicIpIdToHostname containing a null key or null value
  (not sure what; it’s deprecated so not worrying about it!).
- Instead of ImmutableMap for copying it, use MutableMap.copyOf
  so will not fail on null.

Fix softlayer: delete custom code; rely on jclouds

- The SoftLayerFastVirtualGuestToNodeMetadata broke softlayer for me:
  when I provisioned a VM, the NodeMetadata returned had a null imageId
  and null OperatingSystem, which caused an NPE in
  JcloudsLocation.createUser.
- Deleting that class to rely on normal jclouds 1.8 fixed the problem
  for me.

-package brooklyn.location.jclouds.config;
-
-import org.jclouds.softlayer.compute.functions.VirtualGuestToNodeMetadata;
-
-import com.google.inject.AbstractModule;
-
-public class BrooklynStandardJcloudsGuiceModule extends AbstractModule {
-    @Override
-    protected void configure() {
-        bind(VirtualGuestToNodeMetadata.class).to(
-                Class.class.cast(SoftLayerFastVirtualGuestToNodeMetadata.class));
-    }
-
-}

message:
Supports periodic persist for RebindManager

- Avoids hammering the CPU too much, by continually serializing
  mementos and persisting them.
- Fixes NPE in AbstractEntity.invalidate
- Fixes location rebind, where was overwriting all fields
  with their default values!
- In EntityManagementSupport, sets currentlyDeployed before
  calling onManagementStarting.
- ScheduledTask: make it useable from java
- Fixes SoftwareProcessEntity rebind (so provisioningLocation is
  restored, and stop can subsequently release the machine)

many minor usability enhancements for chef, as shown by new simple example mysql-chef.yaml

- catch occasional NPE
- don't use ruby `absolute_path` as it is not in some common (older) versions
- better messages on errors
- respond to more flags in simple yaml
- install recipes from local machine (using classpath or file:/// URL's)
- misc tweaks to deploy/archive/install (cc @grkvlt) to run as tasks for traceability

file.patch:
@@ -0,0 +1,26 @@
+name: chef-mysql-sample
+services:
+- type: chef:mysql
+  
+  cookbook_urls:
+    # the standard cookbooks should be packaged as tarballs, unless you have knife installed
+    mysql: file:///tmp/brooklyn-chef/cookbooks/mysql.tgz
+    openssl: file:///tmp/brooklyn-chef/cookbooks/openssl.tgz
+    
+  launch_attributes:
+    mysql:
+      # these attrs are required by the mysql cookbook under node['mysql']
+      # (many others are supported and can also be passed here)
+      server_debian_password: p4ssw0rd
+      server_root_password: p4ssw0rd
+      server_repl_password: p4ssw0rd
+      
+  # how to determine if the process is running and how to kill it
+  # (supported options are `service_name` and `pid_file`; typically pick one)
+  service_name: mysqld
+  #pid_file: /var/run/mysqld/mysqld.pid
+
+location:
+  byon:
+    hosts: 192.168.33.12
+    user: vagrant
